metadata.title: CVE-2018-18511 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-origin images can be read from a canvas element in violation of thesame-origin policy using the transferFromImageBitmap method. *Note: Thisonly affects Firefox 65. Previous versions are unaffected.*. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 65.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
